intro: Trichilia tuberculata subsp. tuberculata, commonly known as the African shea tree, is a tropical tree native to Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and fragrant flowers. The plant produces a hard, oily seed that is widely used in traditional medicine and cosmetics. Its bark and leaves are also valued for their medicinal properties. The tree plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, providing habitat and food for various species.
